data.event: In 1879, the area was opened by the state for homesteading.
The first settler, N.J. Whitfield, arrived in 1899.
On October 17, 1899, he purchased an area of Oldham County known as 'Section 90' for $1.00 per acre.
In 1903, Whitfield sold a 100-foot strip of land that extended across the southern part of Oldham County to the Choctaw, Oklahoma, and Texas (later Rock Island) Railroad as a right-of-way.
A.M. Miller and Howard Trigg surveyed the town site that eventually became Vega in May 1903.

event.title: 1907, ranchers Patrick and John Landergin purchased

data.event: In 1907, ranchers Patrick and John Landergin purchased a part of the LS Ranch from Swift & Company.
The following year, they established a bank in Vega.
